1: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
2: Life is about making an impact, not making an income.
3: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
4: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.
5: We become what we think about.
6: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
7: People often say that motivation doesn.t last. Well, neither does bathing.  That.s why we recommend it daily.
8: If you hear a voice within you say .you cannot paint,. then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced.
9: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be
10: Teach thy tongue to say, .I do not know,. and thous shalt progress.
11: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
12: If the wind will not serve, take to the oars.
13: The person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
14: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
15: Remember that not getting what you want is sometimes a wonderful stroke of luck.
16: Happiness is not a goal, but a by-product.
17: Fortify yourself with contentment, for this is an impregnable fortress.
18: Things work out best for those who make the best of how things work out.
19: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
20: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
21: Whenever you see a successful person you only see the public glories, never the private sacrifices to reach them.
22: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
23: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear--not absence of fear.
24: Don't let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
26: An oak is not felled at one blow.
27: Constant dripping hollows out a stone.
28: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
29: After the game, the king and the pawn go into the same box.
30: You may find the worst enemy or best friend in yourself.
31: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
